title: fellowship
comment: Association based upon the sharing of something in common. Believers have fellowship with one another on the basis of their common fellowship with God, their participation in the blessings of the gospel and their common task of mission. True fellowship is demonstrated in concern for, and practical commitment to, one another.

children.title: fellowship, with God
children.comment: The relationship with God, disrupted by sin yet established through Jesus Christ, which provides the only proper basis for true human fellowship. God's desire for fellowship with humanity is made known through his calling of a people to be his own and to reflect his holiness and love.

children.title: God's fellowship with his people is shown by his presence
God's presence in the new Jerusalem
Fellowship with the Father, Son and Holy Spirit

seealsos.comment: fellowship with the Spirit

children.title: Fellowship is made possible through Jesus Christ

seealsos.comment: Jesus Christ's presence with his disciples
abiding in Christ
united with Christ in his death and resurrection
communion with Christ at the Lord's Supper
sharing in Christ's sufferings

children.title: Fellowship with God is inseparable from fellowship with one another
The demands of fellowship with God
Sin separates people from fellowship with God
fellowship, in the gospel
children.comment: A mutual participation in the blessings of God's grace. Believers are united with one another on the basis of their common reception of the benefits of salvation.

children.title: Fellowship and the community of God's people
God calls out a community of people, for fellowship with himself
God will bless a people united in fellowship

secondaryrefs.comment: Wrong relationships between God's people hinder the flow of his blessing.

children.title: God will restore fellowship with his scattered people

seealsos.comment: sharing in the blessings of the gospel
sharing in God's grace
sharing a common faith
sharing a common calling
sharing a common hope
sharing the divine nature
sharing in sanctification
the family prayer in which believers together address God as Father

children.title: Fellowship in holding a common truth
fellowship, in Christian service
children.comment: Partnership in a common enterprise. God's people are called to work together especially in the task of mission, to recognise one another's gifts and to give support to one another's ministries.

primaryrefs.comment: The Philippians share in Paul's work through their giving.

children.title: Fellowship between Paul and his co-workers
In fellowship different gifts are combined for effective service
Spiritual gifts are given to all to share
Examples of sharing in different roles
Examples of working together in fellowship

seealsos.comment: the Reubenites and the Gadites join with the rest of Israel to conquer Canaan
all Israel unites against Gibeah
Those returning from exile work together to rebuild the temple
The Israelites work together to rebuild the walls of Jerusalem
Peter and Andrew, James and John are business partners.

children.title: fellowship, among believers
children.comment: The fellowship that believers share as a result of their common union with God through Jesus Christ is expressed in life together. It is evident in worship together, in a love for one another which reflects God's own love and in a practical commitment to one another which is demonstrated in concern for the weak and readiness to share with the poor and needy.

children.title: Sharing in the fellowship of God's love
Sharing in the fellowship of a common devotional life

secondaryrefs.comment: Love feasts accompanied the Lord's Supper though these were open to abuse.

children.title: True fellowship means sharing with those in need

seealsos.comment: God's people are to reflect his concern for the needy in society

children.title: Examples of sharing with the needy
Strengthening one another in fellowship together
Putting the needs of others first
True fellowship means living in harmony

secondaryrefs.comment: Troublemakers in David's army are unwilling to share the spoils
factions within the church at Corinth
Selfishness at love feasts humiliates the poor.
